result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel J Olin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING November 6, 2015 at 1:30 p.m. in Br. 40.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case i ncluding any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as ordered.  Court found the domestic abuse surcharge is applicable. Bail to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Obtain and maintain employment and/or school.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No violent contact with the victim during rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
Parties cannot live together unless approved by the agent.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling.
Continue with current counseling.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Pay all supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recomended treatment including random screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Samuel J Olin in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Samuel J Olin in court with attorney Dudley A. Williams.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Monica E.  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months concurrent in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days concurrent in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 11/06/15.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Continue with current counselling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
  Parties cannot live together unless approved by the agent.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment and/or school.
-No firearms; weapons.
-DNA sample, pay the surcharge.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea date scheduled for 09-11-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Samuel J Olin in court with attorney Dudley A. Williams.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discussion on the record with the parties.  Defendant has two cases before Branch 40, however only this case on today's calendar.
Case# 15CM001455 scheduled for review hearing on 10-30-2015.

Defense counsel requests both cases be adjourned on the same date.  Court orders this case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 40.
Court advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set including the No Contact Order.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Samuel J Olin in court with attorney Dudley A. Williams.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 07-15-2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Monica E. or her residence or place of employment

Defendant Samuel J Olin in court with attorney Dudley A. Williams.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 40.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/30/15 @ 1:30pm
